comments:
I noted that the fields in the property pages and the menus are still enabled when the file is read only and that the file appears to become dirty when I change properties. Truly, there are some dialog popping up about the file being read-only asking me if I want to make it writeable.

For example if a WSDL file is read only and I use the outline view to add an import I get the nice dialog, and if I click No, the file becomes "dirty" and the following exception goes in the log:

org.w3c.dom.DOMException: 
	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.document.NodeContainer.insertBefore(NodeContainer.java:248)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.document.ElementImpl.insertBefore(ElementImpl.java:684)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.internal.impl.WSDLElementImpl.forceNiceInsertBefore(WSDLElementImpl.java:830)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.internal.impl.WSDLElementImpl.niceInsertBefore(WSDLElementImpl.java:761)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.internal.impl.WSDLElementImpl.handleElementForAdopt(WSDLElementImpl.java:749)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.internal.impl.WSDLElementImpl.adoptContent(WSDLElementImpl.java:637)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.internal.impl.WSDLElementImpl.eNotify(WSDLElementImpl.java:380)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.internal.impl.DefinitionImpl.eNotify(DefinitionImpl.java:506)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreEList.dispatchNotification(EcoreEList.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.addUnique(NotifyingListImpl.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.add(BasicEList.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.internal.impl.DefinitionImpl.addImport(DefinitionImpl.java:557)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.ui.internal.commands.AddImportCommand.run(AddImportCommand.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.ui.internal.adapters.commands.W11AddImportCommand.execute(W11AddImportCommand.java:33)
